topic.title: Restarting Freezer Backups after Reboot or Crash

sectiondiv.p: Every time the freezer-scheduler is restarted on a node (or anytime a node is rebooted), this procedure must be applied. For example, during an upgrade process that requires node rebooting, freezer-schedulers are rebooted. In this case, if you do not follow this procedure after those reboots, no backup will be taken after the freezer-scheduler is restarted. In the case where the freezer-scheduler was restarted on every node, the procedure is as follows:
From the deployer, navigate to the indicated directory and run the following commands:
sectiondiv.codeblock: cd /home/stack/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible -i hosts/verb_hosts FRE-AGN --sudo -m file -a 'path=/etc/freezer/scheduler/to_upload state=absent' ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts _freezer_manage_jobs.yml
sectiondiv.p: If the freezer-scheduler has been restarted on only a specific node, in the case of a crash or single reboot, for example, the procedure is as follows:
From the deployer, navigate to the indicated directory and run the following commands:
sectiondiv.codeblock: cd /home/stack/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible --limit <hostname of the node> -i hosts/verb_hosts FRE-AGN --sudo -m file -a 'path=/etc/freezer/scheduler/to_upload state=absent' ansible-playbook --limit <hostname of the node> -i hosts/verb_hosts _freezer_manage_jobs.yml
sectiondiv.p: More information on the upstream bug is available here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/freezer/+bug/1546269
